data.title: The Organization S.F: Savor The Flavor CD (1995) All Death Angel members (minus the singer). Check the exclusive video showing this CD for sale Check VIDEO + a video that explains the story of the ban
data.meta_description: Check the exclusive video showing this CD for sale Check the exclusive video showing this CD for sale 1982-1991 (as Death Angel), 1991-1995, 2001-present (as Death Angel) This band was formed by the remaining members of Death Angel following their split after the departure of vocalist Mark Osegueda. 2nd c.d. from this modern sounding band, that derives from the Thrash […]
data.text:
Description

2nd c.d. from this modern sounding band, that derives from the Thrash Metal band, Death Angel. Very good stuff, on Bulletproof / Music For Nations.

Excellent! This group was very under appreciated! All they are is Death Angel without Mark!

The Organization – Savor the Flavor 1995

Label: Bullet Proof Records – CDVEST 50

Format: CD, Album

Country: UK

Released: 1995

Style: Funk Metal, Hard Rock

1. “Savor the Flavor” (2:37)

2. “So Full of Lies” (4:31)

3. “Doomsday Eve” (3:37)

4. “A Way Today” (3:50)

5. “Had A Long Today” (4:18)

6. “The Chase” (3:17)

7. “War 25” (4:05)

8. “Begin A Life” (2:35)

9. “The Drought” (2:13)

10. “Insomnia” (3:05)

11. “Stupid Mood” (2:59)

12. “By the Time” (9:41)

This video explains the story of the band:

Surprisingly Obscure

occasionally you get an obscure band that really deserves a lot more credit than they get. This is one of them.

This album sounds like a cross of 80s metal and the Red Hot Chili Peppers. It has great power chords, good lyrics, and at times, that funk-rock sound that the Red Hot Chili Peppers have.

There really isn’t a lot more for me to say about this album, except that it rocks. If you like Queensryche, Red Hot Chili Peppers, or other 80s heavy metal, then buy this album. You won’t be disappointed.

———————————————————–
